ingredients.text: 4 chinese sweet sausages (lachang or lop chong)
4 pieces chinese cured meats of any kind (larou; each about 10 inches long), or 2 pieces chinese smoked pork belly and 1 (8 ounce) piece chinese smoked pork shoulder

1 pound Chinese broccoli, trimmed (or 2 bunches Broccolini)

250g chinese spinach – ends trimmed, separate stems and leaves
1 tablespoon dry anchovies – rinsed and pat dry

2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for coating the pan
large knob of ginger , peeled and cut into matchsticks

bunch spring onions , whites and greens sliced
400.0g pork tenderloins , cut into long thin strips

739.name: Chinese Hot and Sour Soup recipes

ingredients.text: 6 dried wood/tree ear or cloud ear mushrooms
6 dried dried shiitake mushrooms (aka Chinese black mushrooms)
4 cups Chinese Superior Stock (see below) or chicken broth or chicken stock or vegetable broth

8 ounces firm tofu, drained and sliced in 1/4-inch strips
4 tablespoons Chinese black vinegar (aka Chinkiang vinegar)
1 tablespoon chili sauce, such as sambal oelek

4 cups chicken broth or chicken stock or vegetable broth

2 inches gingerroot, 1 inch grated and 1 inch sliced
4 to 6 thin scallions, 1/2 minced, 1/2 finely chopped
1 to 2 large cloves garlic, 1/2 grated and 1/2 sliced
1 to 2 red chiles (depending on your preferred level of heat), seeded and sliced
1½ cups jasmine or carolina rice (this is one of the few instances where basmati isn’t an appropriate long-grain variety)
2 quarts broth or water, or more as needed
1 teaspoon salt or more to taste
4 ounces pickled chinese vegetables (see notes), rinsed and finely chopped
1 bunch of scallions, both green and white parts, finely chopped
3 tablespoons finely chopped hot fresh chilies, such as thai chilies or serrano chilies, or 5 tablespoons milder (but still hot) chilies such as jalapeños
Soy sauce (even though this dish is chinese, i prefer japanese dark soy sauce)
1 pound pork tenderloins, the thin end of a beef tenderloin, lean steaks, or leftover meats
2 tablespoons peanut oil or more as needed (if you’re sautéing raw meat as a condiment)
2 x Pickled Mustard green, squeezed and julienned
